argument.description: The string to test for a null value.
The value returned if string1 is null.

returnType: The NVL function returns a substitute value.
description: The Oracle/PLSQL NVL function lets you substitute a value when a null value is encountered.
sample:
SELECT NVL(supplier_city, 'n/a')
FROM suppliers; SELECT supplier_id,
NVL(supplier_desc, supplier_name)
FROM suppliers; SELECT NVL(commission, 0)
FROM sales;
